detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value:
Delivery Mode -This is a synchronous multi-access course. Students are expected to meet on the days and times listed, either in-person or online. All courses labelled ‘multi-access’ offer students the choice of completing the course online, in-person, or using a mix of both. In-person attendance is NOT required, but the option to attend in-person is available. Lectures may be streamed from a classroom and/or uploaded online after class.

Waitlist Policy -All waitlists will follow a first come, first serve policy, unless specified otherwise. Once a course is full, its status will be changed to “Waitlist” and students who register will be automatically added to the waitlist.

instances.text: PHAR_V 205-001 - Clinical Epidemiology & Pharmaceutical Outcomes I
PHAR_V 280-001 - Pharmaceutical Topics and Communication Seminar II

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value: Course Description: An introduction to formal (sentential and quantifier) logic. Students will learn to translate natural-language arguments into formal systems and evaluate their logical forms for validity. Emphasis on translation from natural language; truth tables and interpretations; proof systems up to relational predicate logic with identity. Also introductory metalogic, including proofs of soundness and completeness.

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value:
Course delivery mode: Hybrid = Lectures synchronous online + Exams (midterm and final) in person
(Synchronous Online: learning activities that happen at the same time for the instructor and the learners, facilitating real-time interaction between them.)
Course Description: An introduction to formal (sentential and quantifier) logic. Students will learn to translate natural-language arguments into formal systems and evaluate their logical forms for validity. Emphasis on translation from natural language; truth tables and interpretations; proof systems up to relational predicate logic with identity. Also introductory metalogic, including proofs of soundness and completeness.

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value:
This section of PHIL230 will only involve full class meetings (no discussion section meetings). To register, students must also register for PHIL230.L08, but this “discussion section” will not involve additional scheduled meetings.

This is a Synchronous Online course: learning activities that happen at the same time for the instructor and the learners, facilitating real-time interaction between them.

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value: This discussion section, which does not involve additional scheduled meetings, is for students registered in PHIL230.003.

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value: PHIL240.003 has mandatory discussion sections. Students are required to register in one of the following discussion sections: L01, L02, or L04. (L03 was cancelled.)

uiLabels.WDRES.FACETEDSEARCH.SymanSyntax:
Boolean logic can be expressed using AND, OR, NOT, and (). 
Exact phrases can be surrounded by double quotation marks. 
Example: ("software engineer" OR computer science) AND ~manager~.
